topology

Class Topology1D

  • java.lang.Object
    • topology.Topology1D

  • public class Topology1D
extends java.lang.Object
    An object that specifies how a CellArray1D should retrieve neighborhoods. This object specifies the size and geometry of neighborhoods in the client CellArray2D and specifies an identity space over the client.
    Author:
    Zach Tidwell
    See Also:
    Base}, {@link Space}, {@link CellArray1D}, {@link Automaton1D},

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Topology1D.Base
      An enumeration of the supported neighborhood geometries: radial, left, right, Each item has a field containing the appropriate method name in CellArray1D so that a Topology1D object can specify which method the target CellArray1D should use for neighborhood lookup.
      static class  Topology1D.Circle
      The Standard topology inner class for subsets of R^1 where all boundary points are identified with themselves.
      static class  Topology1D.Space
      An enumeration of the supported identity spaces: Standard, Circle Each item has a field containing the name of the inner class in Topology1D which contains the appropriate identity functions for that identity space.
      static class  Topology1D.Standard
      The Standard topology inner class for subsets of R^2 where all boundary points are identified with themselves.

      Fields

      int coarseness
      Represents the granularity of this topology, or in other words, the radius of the neighborhood about a given Cell.

    • Field Detail

      • coarseness

        public int coarseness
        Represents the granularity of this topology, or in other words, the radius of the neighborhood about a given Cell. 1 is this finest topology and the topology becomes coarser for each successive int value. A topology can have arbitrary coarseness.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Topology1D

        public Topology1D(Topology1D.Base basis,
          int coarseness,
          Topology1D.Space space)
        Creates a Topology1D object that specifies how a CellArray1D should retrieve neighborhoods. The given Basis specifies the geometry of the neighborhood. The supported neighborhood geometries are enumerated in Topology21.Base. Moreover, the size of this neighborhood is controlled by the coarseness parameter. Coarseness can be any int value, but if coarseness is negative, the absolute value will be used. The space parameter specifies which identity functions this Topology1D should provide to the target CellArray1D. The Types of identity spaces supported are enumerated in Topology1D.Space.
        Parameters:
        basis - The neighborhood geometry selected for this topology
        coarseness - sets the size of the neighborhoods about a given Cell.
        space - The identification space associated with this Topology.

    • Method Detail

      • idI

        public int idI(int x,
      int length)
        The first identify function which maps the row index "i" of the target CellArray2D as specified by this Topology2D.
        Parameters:

        public java.lang.Class<?> getSpace()
